content.title: National Science Chair- Scientific Excellence
content.details: The National Science Chair: Scientific Excellence & Science Leadership scheme aims to recognize active eminent senior resident Indian superannuated scientists for their outstanding contributions in the areas of Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM), and Medicine, to promote excellence and growth in R&D. The scheme provides chairs/professorships instituted by various ministries/departments/academies with public funds.
benefits: An amount of ₹1.5 lakhs per month will be given to the awardee as a fellowship.
The Research Grant will be ₹25 lakhs per annum.
For overhead expenses, ₹1.0 lakh per annum will be given to the host institution.
eligibility: The nominee should be an active resident Indian scientist/academician, with an outstanding research track record in any one or more areas of STEM and medicine, particularly during the last five years.
The nominee must have received recognition for his/her work from national/international scientific bodies such as fellowship in prestigious academies and S&T awards.
The nominee could be affiliated with an academic institution/R&D lab or should have consent on the subject from the future host institution.

The nominee should not hold any administrative roles and functions and is not in receipt of any honorarium/fellowship/salary from any other institute or organization at the time of initiation of the NSC award if offered by SERB.
content.application_process: Nominations are accepted in online mode only through the SERB online portal. The call for nominations will not be periodic and will be made from time to time subject to vacancies available every year.
documents_required: Research Proposal with brief Introduction, Objective, Methodology, Budget, and expected outcome (up to five pages)
Endorsement Letter by the head of the Host Institute

faqs.question: What is the mode to submit my nomination for National Science Chair (NSC) Award?
faqs.answer: The nominations are being accepted in online mode only through SERB online portal i.e. www.serbonline.in.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applying under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The nominee should be an active resident Indian scientist/academician, with an outstanding research track record in any one or more areas of STEM and medicine, particularly during the last five years.

faqs.question: Can I apply for Mode-I and Mode-II under NSC at the same time, if I fulfil the formal requirements?
faqs.answer: No, it is not possible to apply for both modes at the same time.
